Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, affordable, great pool and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jeeje
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family nearby and also had plans at The Galleria. This was an excellent location, easy to find and to use as a home base. We had young grandchildren with us who love hotel breakfasts. The breakfasts did not disappoint. Jimmy Dean microwavable egg, bacon and sausage sandwiches were good as were the Texas shaped waffles, lots of fruit, yogurt, cereals, hot oatmeal, and pastries. We used the very clean pool and hot tub--we are very picky about hotel pools and this was one of the best. The beds were the most comfortable we had had in awhile! Plenty of room in rooms for the 2 queens, desk, two chairs, and dresser. The hotel is not brand new and you see that in the bathroom tiles which were a little loose. But, the carpets seemed new and the air conditioner worked great. Only reason I didn't give this an excellent rating is that I reserve that for more spacious rooms and totally updated floors, etc. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWIBC
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a family, area could be considered sketchy, but no issues even with the Gas Station right beside it. Hotel was nice inside and the staff was super. Stayed 4 nights and even though room was cramped with 4 people in the room it was tolerable. The breakfast was adequate but not up to par for the price paid. Pool was nice for the kids to run off energy, but can be very loud in the pool area due to acoustics. Room was good size with king bed and a sofa bed, but day 2 had a strong mildew smell that popped up and remained the rest of the stay. Overall B+ a good hotel although could be considered a little pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel. Will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte V
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating, though most of the housekeeping staff does not speak English. Room was clean except for one spot on the bedspread but I never use hotel bedspreads anyway, so it wasn't a big deal for me. Everything else was fresh and clean. Entire hotel is non-smoking which is a major plus for me. Pets are allowed with a deposit but if people actually take their pets there, you'd never know it. There was no smell at all nor did I have any issues with allergies from pet dander. Beds and pillows were VERY comfortable. Rooms and hallways were very quiet. We never heard our neighbors or any outside noise at all. Windows do open but it was too warm for us to take advantage of that. When we checked in the AC had already been turned on for us so the room was nice and cool - perfect after such a long drive. Hot tub and pool area were very clean and no too many people used them. However, the chlorine smell was VERY strong and caused some eye and allergy irritation for some of us - even those who didn't get into the water. We were able to prop open the emergency exit door to the outside and it got a little better. Room has a fairly low ceiling so if they used better ventilation or had a higher glass ceiling, it might not be so bad. Also, there is a lot of echo in that room - more than you'd think - and it's hard to carry on a conversation, even in the hot tub. Continenal breakfast included make-your-own-waffles and the waffle iron was shaped like Texas, which everyone thought was cool. Also had a limited selection of bagels, english muffins, bread for toast. Bananas and apples were the fruit choices. Small boxes of Kelloggs cereals available. Also had sausage biscuits, breakfast burritos and sausage/pancake corndogs that could be microwaved. No microwave in the rooms but the breakfast room was open 24 hours so you could use that if needed. Several restaurants and fast food places close by. Also not far from both Kroger and Walmart Supercenter. Overall, not a place I'd go if I was looking for a vacation where you relax at the hotel- rooms are fairly small but adequate for sleeping. Double queen room does not have enough room for an added rollaway, for example. But for an on-the-go vacation where all you need is a clean comfy place to sleep, a decent breakfast and that's convenient to everything, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: mamiya22
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with kids. Very nice hotel adjacent to a food establishments. 8 minutes from Dallas Galleria. Hotel staff was very helpful and accommodating. Breakfast was served from 6-9am. Cereals, pastries and waffles. INDOOR swimming pool, and jazuzzi, that was the key to getting the kids to sleep. About 35 minutes to Texas Rangers Stadium and Dallas Cowboys. Enjoyed our stay all-around. Cold AC, excellent beds and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, clean, convenient, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: Anya4
Reviews.Content: I was initially unsure about the place when I booked it. I stayed for one night..found the hotel very clean, quiet and convenient. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Irma47
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3 nights and all the staff was very nice. breakfast was good. hotel was very clean. and the beds very comfortable. also enjoyed the pool and hot tub which was close to our room. desk clerks gave us helpful information with directions to find different things. would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds - No Flat Screen”
Reviews.Author: tlc911
Reviews.Content: Easy Check in, fairly safe parking area even though it is right off Greenville and 635. Know where you are coming before trying to find this place. Hotel staff not very good at explaining it is called Park Central but a few miles from there. However, service at check in, breakfast are, swimming pool (indoor) and fitness center appear clean and neat. Rooms are typical, a bit small for a large chair and ottoman. We were in a double with adjoining rooms. Don't lock yourself out like we did, the adjoining door will close on you and if the safety latch is closed on your door it is very challenging to get in, although it was done courteously by late night staff. Breakfast consists of boiled eggs, waffles, breads and muffins with toaster and microwave supplied. Apples for fresh fruit, small containers of dannon yogurt, fruit cups and fresh boxed milks from a fridge. A large pot of oatmeal with raisins coconut and peanut butter for toppings. Fresh hot coffee supplied in a nice large room with a flat screen tv on the wall. Indoor pool was like a sauna, not so bad if you are swimming off your breakfast. Fitness room has a few free weights along with treadmills and stationary bikes. Overall not bad. Could use upgrades on the TV, no PPV.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: PrincessEthel
Reviews.Content: We travel to this area of Dallas frequently and stayed at this Fairfield twice in May. We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms are always nice and clean with everything in working order. The front desk staff has always been very curteous, friendly and helpful. The breakfast options are pretty standard but the breakfast experience is made outstanding by the young lady that works there. She is the most friendly, helpful, smiling person! She welcomes you when you come in and offers to assist you, she brings extra napkins to the tables, offers to refill drinks and wishing you a good day when you leave. She does all of this while keeping the breakfast items stocked and the counters clean. She was a very pleasant surprise! We will certainly stay at this hotel and again recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL200GIRL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a definite MUST stay! In my opinion, the price we paid ($110 total for two nights) was too cheap. You gotta see it for yourself. The rooms were a good size. We had a nice view; we stayed on the 3rd floor. I tell you, I was shocked to learn that this hidden treasure turned out to be so great. The only minor problem, which I didn't report, was the odor in the room--it was sort of a musty, old smell. But heck, for the price we paid, it wasn't too much trouble for me to spray Febreeze and Lysol to freshen the room up. The beds were SUPER comfortable. I felt like I was sleeping in my own bed at home. My husband and I used the workout room which only had three machines, but it got the job done. Oh my God, the front desk staff on Saturday morning was SO friendly. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. You gotta see it for yourself. So, if ever looking for a bargain in this part of Dallas, please stay here. You might get the same value at the Homewood Suites next door or at the Holiday Inn across the street, but I guarantee you'll pay a whole lot more for the same exact service you could recieve at the Fairfield Inn Dallas Park Central. Thanks a bunch to the mangement and staff for leaving such a lasting and pleasant impresssion on me and my family!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: meenak621
Reviews.Content: The staff was really helpful and the rooms were well kept.

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: daisymae48
Reviews.Content: I gotta say, I was pleasantly surprised when I opened our door! The room was SO clean, new carpet, bedding gorgeous and the BEDS!! WOW! I have never slept on hotel beds that were so comfortable. Even my own bed at home is not that comfortable. I could have stayed in there all day!! My back is really bad right now and I was worried if I was going to live through this, so I was so grateful when I slept like a baby. The staff is "down-home" and are so helpful. Just don't listen to them about restaurant recommendations....Whew! I will definetly go back there if I'm ever in Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: vmanis
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I reserved this hotel for our annual girl weekend. We decided to bring our mothers along. When we got to our room our mom's found little black bugs all over. The front desk changed their room but the temperature in their new room was freezing. We never could get the temperature right. They called the front desk for blankets and there were none. Then we found a fire ant in one of our beds. The trash can was not empty and was full of black hair. The gal who worked the front desk was nice but was limited in helping us. It was not her fault. As a result we are canceling the rest of our stay and moving to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Richard038
Reviews.Content: Attended a family reunion. 9 adults with two young children (1 & 4). Total of 5 rooms. Very quiet and clean. Everything worked. Kids enjoyed to indoor pool. Central to everywhere we wanted to go. Staff attentive. Only negative was high humidity in corridors. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with Fairfield Inn Dallas Park Central”
Reviews.Author: Bob5595
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel for three nights in December. When we arrived there was a party in progress with loud music in a meeting room just off the lobby. We were assigned a room on the 2nd floor where we could hear all the loud music. We asked to change rooms. The staff was very pleasant and gave us a room in a quieter part of the hotel. We noticed some maintenance problems in our room. The smoke detector was missing. Only the base plate for the detector was present on the ceiling and there were electrical wires dangling down. Also, we noticed that the lock on the window was broken. A large piece of the latch was missing and the window could not be locked. I took photos of these items for documentation purposes. The room was clean but furnishings seemed rather spartan. There were no pictures on the wall. Also no small refrigerator. In our opinion, just sort of a bare bones room. We stayed the first night and checked out the next morning. We just didn't feel safe in this hotel with a missing smoke detector in our room and a broken window latch. We wondered: How many other rooms in the hotel are in this condition? Just how well is this hotel maintained? The staff was very friendly and helpful but we just did not have a good feeling about the hotel based on what appeared to us to be inadequate maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FriscoBarbie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Fairfield Inn six times, the most recently in September, 2006 during a househunting trip. We have never had a bad experience there. The front desk staff is always accomodating and pleasant, the rooms are clean (love the queen sized beds), and the pool area (an indoor pool) is very nice! The location is also very convenient - you are 10-15 minutes away from Presbyterian Hospital, Plano, Northpark Mall, and Garland/Mesquite. And the room rates with AAA discount are always an unbelievably good deal. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average for a Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doodlebug4me
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed for one night at this hotel on the weekend. It was very clean and comfortable with some nice extras - for example, the bathrooms are roomy and the matresses seemed to be almost new - the pillows were actually comfortable and plentiful - and the room included a nice breakfast. Would definitely stay here again - great value for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn Dallas Park Central
HotelInfo.Address: 9230 LBJ Freeway, Dallas, TX 75243
